intro: Scolopia nitida, commonly known as the silverleaf scolopia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray, fuzzy leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for xeriscaping in arid regions. Scolopia nitida is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
